name: Wednesday Night Dinner Middle Eastern Flamenco Fusion with Fiesta Swing
description: Combining the passionate sounds of Flamenco and vibrant Persian melodies, Fiesta Swing creates a unique musical fusion for any occasion. Performing music inspired by Paco de Lucia, Vincente Amigo, Jesse Cook, this versatile band is guaranteed to uplift and enhance any occasion.

name: Professor Alice Roberts: From Cell to Civilization
description:
Acclaimed author, anthropologist and BBC broadcaster Professor Alice Roberts delivers a thrilling new live show. This state-of-art multimedia experience will take us on the incredible journey of humankind and will explore the connectivity of all things from the first spark of life 3.8 billion years ago, to the rise of early civilizations across the globe. 

The show will examine the fascinating connections between our past and our present through the lens of genetics and archaeology and we will learn how we know what we know, and why we think what we think. This is the story of us, from a single cell to civilization.

name: Starry Paint Night Workshop
description: Paint like a great at this Van Gogh inspired paint night. We'll show you step by step how to recreate this piece with the option to pick your own colours and composition. Enjoy a fun yet relaxing, creative experience at this paint night designed for beginners and experienced artists alike.

name: Art Celebration at Gladstone House
description:
Gladstone House unveils It Starts with a Photograph, part of the CONTACT Photography Festival. Four exhibitions and installations by Nika Belianina, Laura Butler, Heather Haynes and Virginia Macdonald, Laura Kay Keeling, and Jessica Thalmann use photographs as the starting point for experimentation and reinterpretation.

Then visit the Art Studio to see works in progress by Resident Artists Ailin Dong, Mohammadali Khosravi and Theodore Walker Robinson.

name: ReDress at Scarborough Museum
description:
ReDress is a mixed media work/painting/installation which acknowledges Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women Girls 2Spirit People, their (chosen) families with the use of multimedia explorations such as sound, image and installation components to provoke thought, to honour and to memorialise our Sisters, thereby attempting to invoke activations to redress some of the realities Indigenous Women face in society. 
 
The artwork will consist of a room; a sacred space in which the viewer will be invited to feel several aspects of memorialisation. The work will include traditional and experimental aspects.

name: GradEx110
description:
Toronto's largest free art and design exhibition. Be inspired by the work of more than 800 emerging artists and designers at OCAD U's 100 McCaul St. location.

The event features displays from graduating students in every discipline, sales of student work, an alum lounge and a special exhibition of medal-winning student work in the Great Hall. A supplemental online exhibition will also launch on May 7.

name: RapidTO: Bathurst Street Survey
description:
The City of Toronto and Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) invite residents to learn more and provide feedback on RapidTO: Bathurst Street. Public opinion, along with technical and policy considerations, will be used to inform staff recommendations and decisions made by City Council. Provide feedback by attending a public event, completing the survey, email or phone. 
Complete the online feedback survey by May 26 to provide your feedback on the considered design.

name: Don Valley Art Club 2025 Spring Awards Show & Sale

address.streetAddress: MJPR+78 Todmorden Mills Park, 67 Pottery Rd

description:
Live in Gallery and online! We are excited to showcase our award winning artworks once again. See 80+ new artworks in the Gallery and even more  artworks online, over 80 members offer a variety of mediums, subject matter and style. The Gallery will be open and staffed to assist visitors each week. 

Enhance your visit and gallery experience, by joining us for Super Sundays every weekend in and around the Gallery. Our members will be demonstrating their artmaking techniques! Join us and talk with the artists! Printmaking, portraits, paint-around, kids event, plein air and more!

name: Textured Art Workshop
description: Treat yourself to the relaxing experience of creating Textured Art. Learn our texture paste recipe and play with patterns and tools to create art you can hang on your walls. Come with a friend, or on your own. No experience needed!

name: Fleurs de Villes Spring: Bloor-Yorkville
description: Celebrate the joyous new season. This one-of-a-kind event brings together top Toronto florists and Bloor-Yorkville businesses to create 30 stunning floral installations. Set to the theme of Spring, this uplifting event will feature a Blossoming Spring Tree, Butterfly Mannequin, a Spring Swing, a Blooming Greenhouse, a Spring Fountain Arch, and a stunning Spring Floral Tunnel at the Village of Yorkville Park. There will also be floral archways, picture frames, and plenty of other photo-op moments! Along the trail, guests can enjoy live music, a fresh flower market, and floral demonstrations. This is a self-guided tour, free to attend, and open to all ages.
